intro: Leucopogon polymorphus, commonly known as the variable heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
